summary:

üì± Built LegalEase ‚Äì auto-generates legal docs from minimal input. Also crafted an OpenAPI spec generator for any CRM (Gemini Long Context Challenge üß©).

üíª Full-stack dev with scraping/automation tools using Selenium, Playwright & BeautifulSoup. Backend magic with Flask, Express, NodeJS; frontend skills in HTML/CSS/JS.

‚ö° Also worked with Kafka for distributed streaming, Docker for deployments & Rust for high-performance modules. All about scalable, efficient engineering.

üìà Currently building a startup in AI ‚Äì collaborated with Langchain‚Äôs cofounder, contributed to CrewAI, and growing fast.

text:
üöÄ Just launched: Open_PDF2Brainrot ‚Äî The Free, Open‚ÄëSource PDF‚ÜíBrainrot Converter! 
Exams are approaching fast , and I wanted to try the viral PDF to Brainrot microlearning technique. But all the popular tools? Behind steep paywalls. üí∏
So‚Ä¶ I decided to build my own; and I‚Äôm sharing it with everyone. Say hello to: Open_PDF2Brainrot üéâ
What it does:
 ‚úÖ Upload any PDF (‚â§25 pages recommended if Gemini API key is free tier)
 ‚úÖ Auto‚Äëgenerate clean, structured JSON flashcards üìë
 ‚úÖ Turn them into short, punchy Brainrot videos üé•
 ‚úÖ Browse everything in a slick, responsive web UI üåê
 ‚úÖ Navigate flashcards + videos like a social feed üîÅ
Tech Stack Highlights:
 ‚öôÔ∏è Python + Django backend
 üìÑ PyPDF2 for parsing your PDF
 üéû MoviePy + Vosk + kokoro TTS for generating videos
 üí° Gemini API for content generation ü§ñ

üì¢ Check it out, fork it, break it, improve it ‚Äî it's ours! 
üîó https://lnkd.in/g-KCZH3s

posted_at.relative: 8 months ago ‚Ä¢ Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn

text:
üöÄ Leveraging Gemini's Long Context Window to Revolutionize OpenAPI Specification Generation üéâ

Excited to share my submission for the Google Long Context Competition on Kaggle! 
In this project, I explored how Generative AI, powered by Gemini's long-context capabilities, can streamline the creation of OpenAPI specifications for CRMs. üöÄ
OpenAPI specs are crucial for standardizing APIs, enabling seamless integrations, and enhancing developer productivity. üõ†Ô∏èüìà However, crafting them manually can be tedious and error-prone. üòìüìÑ
This approach showcases how AI-driven solutions can revolutionize the way we handle complex technical documentation, making processes faster and more efficient. ‚ö°ü§ñ

In order to optimize Gemini's performance and utilize it's long context memory, I focused on the following areas :
-->Context Caching üíæ
-->Many-Shot Prompting üìÉ
-->In-Context Retrieval üìÇ

My submission for the Google Long Context Competition on Kaggle builds upon these explorations. It focuses on two key areas:

Part 1: Online Documentation Q&A: I leveraged Gemini's ability to process up to 2 million tokens to enable powerful Q&A directly from online documentation. By incorporating context caching üíæ, I significantly improved response times and user experience, making technical information far more accessible. üëç

Part 2: Generating OpenAPI Specifications: The core of my project involved using Gemini to automatically generate OpenAPI specifications from existing API documentation. This is particularly impactful for platforms like CRMs (Customer Relationship Management tools) which often have thousands of lines of documentation. Manually converting this is slow üêå, error-prone ‚ö†Ô∏è, and costly üí∏. Gemini's long context window allows the model to process the entire documentation at once, dramatically improving the accuracy and speed of OpenAPI generation.  ‚ú®

üîó Check out the notebook here: 
https://lnkd.in/dEZ4N9y7

I‚Äôd love your support and feedback! Let me know your thoughts or ideas for improvement. üí°

text:
üéâ Proud to share that my teammate Yatharth Bisht and I were selected for the state-level round of the prestigious RBI 90 Quiz, a nationwide competition for undergraduate students celebrating the 90th anniversary of the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) operations since it was established by the RBI Act in 1934! üéìüáÆüá≥

After successfully clearing the first online round, we had the incredible opportunity to compete at The Hyatt Regency, alongside 67 other talented teams. Though we didn‚Äôt make it to the next round, the experience was invaluable! üôå

The quiz challenged us with questions on: üìñ History
üåç General Knowledge
üìä Economics
üè¶ The history of the RBI itself!

To top it all off, we had the great honor of meeting and listening to stories of some of the top-level executives of RBI and various public sector banks! üôè

What we gained: ‚úîÔ∏è A wealth of knowledge and insight into fascinating topics
‚úîÔ∏è A great learning experience about teamwork and competition üìö
‚úîÔ∏è Enjoyed a delicious lunch üçΩÔ∏è and collected some cool goodies üéÅ

Grateful for the journey and the chance to be part of this special event! Onwards and upwards! üöÄ

#RBI90Quiz #ReserveBankOfIndia #LearningExperience #History #Economics #Competition #Gratitude #NeverStopLearning

author.headline: Freelance Software Developer / Student ‚Ä¢ex-Intern @NewNative ‚Ä¢ @Cobalt ‚Ä¢ @IIT Delhi ‚Ä¢ Joint-Treasurer Technical Council DTU ‚Ä¢ President @IGTS-DTU ‚Ä¢ Co-head @AIMS-DTU ‚Ä¢ DTU CSE(26)

posted_at.relative: 9 months ago ‚Ä¢ Edited ‚Ä¢ Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn

reshared_post.text:
135th rank in Amazon Challenge without LLM??

Success isn‚Äôt always about taking first place‚Äîit‚Äôs about pushing boundaries and learning along the way. A few weeks ago me and my team, HackWayne comprising of Rhytham Aggarwal, Yatharth Bisht and Ishan Srivastava  participated in the Amazon ML Challenge and ranked 135th out of over 700,000 participants and 2,000+ successful submissions.

I‚Äôm sure you all have seen many posts on this challenge that typically make use of an LLM with OCR, reaching around 50-60% accuracy. However, our team developed a model without using any LLM, managing to achieve an accuracy of 50.4%. The task required us to handle 130,000 images in the test dataset, and processing them without a high-speed GPU was time-consuming, which became the biggest bottleneck.

Our Approach:
We divided the images into 30 patches using variable-sized branches, ensuring that maximum information was captured. Each patch was passed through Paddle OCR to check for the presence of text, and we extracted only relevant quantities and units (e.g., all weights in an image for weight entitiy). This transformed the problem into a classification task: given all the possible quantities present in the image, which one is the correct answer? We approached this using Gradient Boosting (XGB) classifiers for each of the eight quantities.

We found that for quantities like weight, wattage, and voltage, the classifier achieved high accuracy since they are easier to reason it (For weight, the weight of whole will always be more than that of it's components). However, it struggled with length, width, and height, which eventually became the bottleneck, reducing the overall accuracy to 50.4%.

Despite its pitfalls, the fact that this idea stood out among a pool of LLM-based solutions is a testament to its potential and how much it can be improved with more time and computing resources.

The hackathon was a fantastic experience, helping me learn a lot while balancing sleep and time management. It was an exciting experience, and I‚Äôm looking forward to more hackathons like this!

#hackthon #amazon #ml #challenge

text:
As of April 2024, I have successfully completed a two-month internship at DraftAi , where I had the incredible opportunity to dive deep into the world of machine learning.
During this enriching journey from February to April, I worked hands-on with cutting-edge technologies and tools. Here are some of the highlights:
üîç Key Technical Learnings:
1. Mastered the use of Hugging Face Inference APIs, allowing me to deploy and manage AI models efficiently.
2. Gained proficiency with OLLAMA and local LLMs, enhancing my skills in managing and implementing large language models.
3 .Acquired substantial experience in fine-tuning and testing large language models, which deepened my understanding of AI's capabilities and limitations.
üå± Non-Technical Growth:
1. Adapted to a hybrid work environment, learning to navigate the complexities of remote and in-person collaborations.
2. Enhanced my skills in technical documentation, which is crucial for clear and effective communication.
3. Improved my ability to organize and prioritize technical tasks, ensuring productivity and efficiency in a fast-paced environment.

A special shout-out to üè´ AIMS-DTU for providing the foundational knowledge and skills that prepared me for this role; and without their support my journey from having zero knowledge about Python to grabbing my first ever technical internship would have not been possible 
I am grateful for this opportunity to grow professionally and personally at DraftAi. 
:
:
üöÄ Looking forward to applying these learnings in future challenges and opportunities!

text:
üéâ Thrilled to announce that I have completed the Deep Learning Specialization from DeepLearning.AI via Coursera! This demanding program included five detailed courses, each aimed at expanding my abilities and understanding in AI and machine learning:
Neural Networks and Deep Learning
Improving Deep Neural Networks: Hyperparameter tuning, Regularization, and Optimization
Structuring Machine Learning Projects
Convolutional Neural Networks
Sequence Models

I want to extend a heartfelt thank you to my mentors and peers at AIMS-DTU for their invaluable support and motivation throughout this experience. Your guidance was crucial in helping me navigate this challenging and rewarding journey.
Excited for what's next and committed to furthering our understanding and capabilities in AI!
#DeepLearning #MachineLearning #AI #Coursera #DeepLearningAI #DataScience #ArtificialIntelligence #TechEducation
